intro: Phyllorkis alopecurus, commonly known as meadow foxtail, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets, typical of grasses. It is typically found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Phyllorkis alopecurus is an annual or biennial plant, depending on the climate, and plays a role in soil stabilization and as forage for livestock.
